Updating Client Machines
SystemBuilder makes it easy to keep previously installed client machines up to date with changes to the distribution. This is done using a YUM plugin module, the sync plugin. SystemBuilder includes the sync plugin by default in the .
SystemBuilder Update Model
The plugin performs two functions:
Establishes the as the master repository for the client system. This disables all other default package repositories, allowing the plugin to get an accurate list of what packages should be installed on the system using packages available in the distribution repository.
Provides a new command line argument sync for use with YUM:
# yum sync
The sync argument behaves similarly to the YUM update argument, with two additions: 1) it adds packages from the distribution repository that are not installed on the client, and 2) it removes packages from the client that do not exist in the repository.
